Package camzup.pfriendly

Class ZImage

java.lang.Object
processing.core.PImage
camzup.pfriendly.ZImage
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, processing.core.PConstants
public class ZImage
extends processing.core.PImage
An extension of PImage, specializing in color gradients and blitting text to an image.

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static int CHECKER_DARK
    Default color for dark checker squares, -11184811 or 1.0 / 3.0 of 255.
    static int CHECKER_LIGHT
    Default color for light checker squares, -5592406 or 2.0 / 3.0 of 255.
    static int DEFAULT_ALIGN
    Default horizontal alignment when creating an image from text: PConstants.LEFT, 37.
    static int DEFAULT_KERNING
    Default spacing between characters, in pixels, when creating an image from text: 0.
    static int DEFAULT_LEADING
    Default spacing between lines, in pixels, when creating an image from text: 8.

    • adjustContrast

      public static processing.core.PImage adjustContrast​(processing.core.PImage source, float fac, processing.core.PImage target)
      Adjusts the contrast of an image by a factor. Uses the CIE LAB color space. The adjustment factor is expected to be in [-1.0, 1.0].
      Parameters:
      source - the source image
      fac - the contrast factor
      target - the target image
      Returns:
      the adjusted image
      See Also:
      Pixels.adjustContrast(int[], float, int[])

      Adjusts a source image's colors in CIE LCH. Assigns the results to a target image.
      Parameters:
      source - the source image
      adjust - the adjustment
      target - the target image
      Returns:
      the adjusted image
      See Also:

    • checker

      public static processing.core.PImage checker​(int a, int b, int cols, int rows, processing.core.PImage target)
      Renders a checker pattern on an image for diagnostic purposes. Ideally, the image dimensions should be a power of 2 (32, 64, 128, 256, 512). The color is expected to be a 32-bit color integer.
      Parameters:
      a - the first color
      b - the second color
      cols - the column count
      rows - the row count
      target - the output image
      Returns:
      the output image

    • checker

      public static processing.core.PImage checker​(int count, processing.core.PImage target)
      Renders a checker pattern on an image for diagnostic purposes. Uses -11184811 and -5592406 as default colors.
      Parameters:
      count - the count
      target - the output image
      Returns:
      the output image

    • conic

      public static processing.core.PImage conic​(float xOrigin, float yOrigin, float radians, Gradient grd, processing.core.PImage target)
      Generates a conic gradient, where the factor rotates on the z axis around an origin point. Best used with square images; for other aspect ratios, the origin should be adjusted accordingly.
      Parameters:
      xOrigin - the origin x coordinate
      yOrigin - the origin y coordinate
      radians - the angular offset
      grd - the gradient
      target - the output image
      Returns:
      the image

    • conic

      public static processing.core.PImage conic​(Vec2 origin, float radians, Gradient grd, processing.core.PImage target)
      Generates a conic gradient, where the factor rotates on the z axis around an origin point.
      Parameters:
      origin - the origin
      radians - the angular offset
      grd - the gradient
      target - the output image
      Returns:
      the image

    • dither

      public static processing.core.PImage dither​(processing.core.PImage target, Color[] palette)
      Dithers an image with the Floyd-Steinberg method. Builds an octree in CIE L*a*b* from an input palette, then finds the nearest color according to Euclidean distance (see CIE76).
      Parameters:
      target - image
      palette - palette
      Returns:
      the image

    • extractPalette

      public static Color[] extractPalette​(processing.core.PImage source, int capacity)
      Extracts a palette from an image with an octree in CIE LAB. The size of the palette depends on the capacity of each node in the octree. Does not retain alpha component of image pixels. Colors produced may not be in gamut.
      Parameters:
      source - the source image
      capacity - the octree capacity
      Returns:
      the color array

    • extractPalette

      public static Color[] extractPalette​(processing.core.PImage source, int capacity, int threshold)
      Extracts a palette from an image with an octree in CIE LAB. The size of the palette depends on the capacity of each node in the octree. Does not retain alpha component of image pixels. The threshold describes the minimum number of unique colors in the image beneath which it is preferable to not engage the octree. Once the octree has been used, colors produced may not be in gamut.
      Parameters:
      source - the source image
      capacity - the octree capacity
      threshold - the minimum threshold
      Returns:
      the color array

    • falseColor

      public static processing.core.PImage falseColor​(Gradient grd, processing.core.PImage target)
      Recolors an image in-place with a color gradient. Also known as a gradient map. The evaluation factor is the product of a pixel's luminance and its transparency.
      Parameters:
      grd - the color gradient
      target - the target image
      Returns:
      the augmented image

    • fill

      public static processing.core.PImage fill​(Color c, processing.core.PImage target)
      Fills an image in place with a color.
      Parameters:
      target - the target image
      c - the fill color
      Returns:
      the image
      See Also:
      Color.toHexIntSat(Color)

    • fill

      public static processing.core.PImage fill​(int c, processing.core.PImage target)

      target - the target image
      Returns:
      the image

    • fromText

      public static processing.core.PImage fromText​(processing.core.PFont font, java.lang.String text)
      Blits glyph images from a PFont onto a single image.
      Images created with this method do not have a reference to a parent PApplet. Defaults to the fill color white.
      Parameters:
      font - the Processing font
      text - the string of text
      Returns:
      the new image

    • fromText

      public static processing.core.PImage fromText​(processing.core.PFont font, java.lang.String text, Color fillClr, int leading)
      Blits glyph images from a PFont onto a single image. The leading and is measured in pixels; negative values are not allowed.

      Images created with this method do not have a reference to a parent PApplet.
      Parameters:
      font - the Processing font
      text - the string of text
      fillClr - the color
      leading - spacing between lines
      Returns:
      the new image

    • fromText

      public static processing.core.PImage fromText​(processing.core.PFont font, java.lang.String text, Color fillClr, int leading, int kerning)

      Images created with this method do not have a reference to a parent PApplet.

      font - the Processing font

      kerning - spacing between characters
      Returns:
      the new image

    • fromText

      public static processing.core.PImage fromText​(processing.core.PFont font, java.lang.String text, Color fillClr, int leading, int kerning, int textAlign)
      Blits glyph images from a PFont onto a single image. The leading and kerning are measured in pixels; negative values are not allowed. The horizontal text alignment may be either center PConstants.CENTER ( 3 ), right PConstants.RIGHT ( 39 ) or left PConstants.LEFT ( 37 ).

      Images created with this method do not have a reference to a parent PApplet.
      Parameters:
      font - the Processing font
      text - the string of text
      fillClr - the color
      leading - spacing between lines
      kerning - spacing between characters
      textAlign - the horizontal alignment
      Returns:
      the new image

    • linear

      public static processing.core.PImage linear​(float xOrigin, float yOrigin, float xDest, float yDest, Gradient grd, processing.core.PImage target)
      Generates a linear gradient from an origin point to a destination point. The origin and destination should be in the range [-1.0, 1.0]. The scalar projection is clamped to [0.0, 1.0].
      Parameters:
      xOrigin - the origin x coordinate
      yOrigin - the origin y coordinate
      xDest - the destination x coordinate
      yDest - the destination y coordinate
      grd - the gradient
      target - the output image
      Returns:
      the image

    • mask

      public static processing.core.PImage mask​(processing.core.PImage under, processing.core.PImage over, int x, int y, processing.core.PImage target)
      Masks the pixels of an under image with the alpha channel of the over image. Offsets the over image by pixel coordinates relative to the top left corner. The target image is set to the size of the under image.
      Parameters:
      under - the under image
      over - the over image
      x - the mask horizontal offset
      y - the mask vertical offset
      target - the target image
      Returns:
      the masked image

    • mirror

      public static processing.core.PImage mirror​(processing.core.PImage source, float xOrigin, float yOrigin, float xDest, float yDest, boolean flip, processing.core.PImage target)
      Mirrors an image across the axis described by an origin and destination. Coordinates are expected to be in the range [0.0, 1.0]. Out-of-bounds pixels are omitted from the mirror.
      Parameters:
      source - the source image
      xOrigin - the origin x
      yOrigin - the origin y
      xDest - the destination x
      yDest - the destination y
      flip - the flip reflection flag
      target - the output image
      Returns:
      the mirrored image
      See Also:
      Pixels.mirrorBilinear(int[], int, int, float, float, float, float, boolean, int[])

    • radial

      public static processing.core.PImage radial​(float xOrigin, float yOrigin, float radius, Gradient grd, processing.core.PImage target)
      Generates a radial gradient. This does not account for aspect ratio, so an image that is not 1:1 will result in an ellipsoid.
      Parameters:
      xOrigin - the x coordinate
      yOrigin - the y coordinate
      radius - the radius
      grd - the gradient
      target - the output image
      Returns:
      the image

    • stretchContrast

      public static processing.core.PImage stretchContrast​(processing.core.PImage source, float fac, processing.core.PImage target)
      Finds the minimum, maximum and mean lightness in a source image. If factor is positive, stretches color to maximum lightness range in [0.0, 100.0]. If factor is negative, compresses color to mean. Assigns result to target array. The factor is expected to be in [-1.0, 1.0].

      If difference between minimum and maximum lightness is negligible, copies source array to target.
      Parameters:
      source - the source image
      fac - the factor
      target - the target image
      Returns:
      the normalized image
      See Also:
      Pixels.stretchContrast(int[], float, int[])

    • stretchContrast

      public static processing.core.PImage stretchContrast​(processing.core.PImage source, processing.core.PImage target)
      Finds the minimum and maximum lightness in a source image. If difference between minimum and maximum lightness is negligible, copies source array to target.
      Parameters:
      source - the source image
      target - the target image
      Returns:
      the normalized image

    • wrap

      public static int[] wrap​(int[] source, int wSource, int hSource, int[] target, int wTarget, int dx, int dy)
      Blits a source image's pixels onto a target image's pixels, using integer floor modulo to wrap the source image. The source image can be offset horizontally and/or vertically, creating the illusion of parallax.
      Parameters:
      source - source pixel array
      wSource - source image width
      hSource - source image height
      target - target pixel array
      wTarget - target image width
      dx - horizontal pixel offset
      dy - vertical pixel offset
      Returns:
      the target pixels

    • wrap

      public static processing.core.PImage wrap​(processing.core.PImage source, processing.core.PImage target, int dx, int dy)
      Blits a source image's pixels onto a target image's pixels, using integer floor modulo to wrap the source image. The source image can be offset horizontally and/or vertically, creating the illusion of parallax.
      Parameters:
      source - the source image
      target - the target image
      dx - horizontal pixel offset
      dy - vertical pixel offset
      Returns:
      the image
